Module mesakit.map.measurements
Package com.telenav.mesakit.map.measurements.geographic

Class Heading

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.mesakit.map.measurements.geographic.Angle
com.telenav.mesakit.map.measurements.geographic.Heading
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection.NextIterator<Angle>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.function.Mapper<Long,Angle>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Arithmetic<Angle>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Maximizable<Angle>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Minimizable<Angle>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Numeric<Angle>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Zeroable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.string.AsString, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.string.StringFormattable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.value.LongValued, com.telenav.kivakit.validation.Validatable, Headed, Serializable, Comparable<Angle>
public class Heading extends Angle implements Headed
A compass heading from 0 to 360 degrees. Several useful constants are provided, a heading can be parsed with parse(String), or a heading can be constructed with several factory methods:
  • degrees(double)
  • radians(double)
  • microdegrees(int)
  • nanodegrees(long)

Basic mathematical operations are provided and a heading can be converted to an approximate compass direction with asApproximateDirection().

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
